alert.note: Alert for Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Reagan; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 07 at 9:40PM CDT until June 07 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Southern Ector County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Northwestern Reagan County in western Texas... Southwestern Howard County in western Texas... Southern Martin County in western Texas... Northeastern Crane County in western Texas... Northern Upton County in western Texas... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 940 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 15 miles west of Lenorah to 8 miles north of Midland International Air and Space Port to near West Odessa, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 99 and 172. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Greenwood, Garden City, Stanton, Forsan, Lomax, Lenorah, Midland International Air and Space Port, West Odessa, Cotton Flat, Midland Airpark, Penwell, Saint Lawrence, Stanton Municipal Aiport, Elbow, Tarzan, Midkiff, Warfield and Skywest Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.

area.areaDesc: Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Reagan; Upton
